body: Limited Ingredients My siberian husky developed a horrible skin condition we've been dealing with for three years now.  I didn't think anything would help.  We have tried all sorts of food - but still he scratched, bit, and his skin would just flake off.  He had no undercoat at all.  Two months ago, we had to have him shaved per vet's recommendation and started him on this Natural Balance.  Amazing.  He loves the food, which is great because he's really picky and will only eat salmon.  But more importantly, he looks like another dog!  His skin disease is all better (knock on wood) and he is just such a happy dog now!

body: First time my 2 dogs will eat dry kibble w/o canned food added I've tried several brands and flavors of quality dog food over the past 4 years and every time my dogs liked it at first but a week or so later refused to eat it unless I mixed canned dog food with it.  I switched from Purina Pro Plan Savor (they recently changed the ingredients for the worse) to Merrick a couple months back and it gave my dogs loose stools within a week.  Decided to buy Natural Balance L.I.D Duck & Brown Rice since it has minimal but high quality ingredients-I bought it locally.  My dogs go crazy over it and don't hesitate once while eating.  No more adding canned food.  Stools are formed but not too hard. Future purchases will be from Amazon since it's more convenient to have it delivered to my house.Update 7/16/21-My dogs now aren't as eager to eat it like they used to but it's difficult to find a limited ingredient dry kibble that isn't super expensive.
subject: Natural Balance L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food, Duck & Brown Rice Formula, 26 Pounds

body: Allergies seem to be gone My GSD has allergies and I’ve been trying to make her food and limit her diet, unfortunately I couldn’t figure out what her allergies were and I was afraid I would miss some important vitamins necessary when home cooking , so I decided to try this dry food mixed with some pressure cooked chicken breast. When I first switched the food her stomach was a little upset for a few days. Now her body has adjusted and she feels much better, her severe itching has all but stopped with the occasional itch here or there. She has only been on this food for about a month and her allergies have drastically improved. Unfortunately she doesn’t devour this like she did when I was making her meals but that’s ok because she looks and feels so much better.

body: Great for dogs with food sensitivities our dog would occasionally have blood in their poop, and they had it the first few days that we gave them this food. but after that this food has turned our dog around for the better. she hasn't pooped any blood of the sort since switching her over to the lamb flavor. I used to work at an older style dog training facility, and they would always give dogs that had food allergies limited ingredient lamb based dry dog food, and I guess that's because dogs are much less likely to be allergic to lamb.In short if you have a dog that has food allergies I would strongly recommend trying out this food.
subject: Natural Balance L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food, Duck & Brown Rice Formula, 26 Pounds

body: Made dogs sick with new formulation We switched our dog to from the small dog to the large dog food, right around the time they reformulated the dog food. She started throwing up regularly and we couldn’t figure out what it was. We have family with a dog who is on the exact same dog food, and has been on it for a long time. She has been incredibly sick with diarrhea since the change in formulation. Many expensive trips to the vet, antibiotics, and nothing seemed to help. At Christmas with all the dogs together we put two and two together... the food is making them both sick! Since changing their food, they have no longer been getting sick. The manufacturer should have to disclose of changes made to a product.
subject: Natural Balance L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food, Duck & Brown Rice Formula, 26 Pounds

body: Best Dog Food on the Market I’m so impressed with the quality of this food and what it has done for my dog. I adopted her in August of this year and she was noticeably dull with some bare patches in her fur. I had initially tried to start her on a different brand of food but it didn’t seem to digest well for her. My mom uses natural balance for her cats and they are extremely healthy with beautiful plush coats. I figured I’d give the dog food a try and noticed an immediate difference. She has no problem digesting the food and she is so soft and shiny compared to how she was when we adopted her. I’ve included a before photo and 2 after photos showing the difference in her appearance.

body: Excellent choice for dogs with allergies About a year ago I had switched my dog to the Acana Wild Atlantic dog food since my dog loves fish and I had heard great reviews of it.. After a few months on the food my dog developed a cough/choking disorder and also developed a filmy yellowish later inside her ears (she has never had any ear mites nor fleas or any ear disorder). Since the vet was closed other than emergencies for coronavirus I had to wait for an appointment since she didn’t appear to be in distress). I was shocked when the vet told me the cough/choke and ear condition was due to food allergies. The vet said older dogs normally do not develop food allergies and asked if I had switched her diet recently. (The diagnosis was after a thorough exam of labs/cultures and xrays).. I was shocked to discover that she had food allergies since I had changed brands of dog food almost annually throughout her life without a problem (she likes variety ha). In any event, my vet suggested a lamb and rice formula would be best for her and suggested a few brands to try. In less than a week on this food my dogs symptoms vanished. The price is also significantly less than Acana (almost 4x lower). I highly suggest this dog food!
subject: Natural Balance L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food, Duck & Brown Rice Formula, 26 Pounds

body: New formula caused stomach problems in my senior dog I've fed this brand to my dog for ages and things were fine until recently. I opened a brand new bag a little while ago and thought things were fine. I came to find out my dog had started throwing up in one of the hidden corners of the house, leading to a pretty major mess for me to clean up. I'm not sure how long he was doing it, but I tried decreasing the amount of food I gave him, eliminating treats, etc.  Then I noticed that on one of my old empty bags of this stuff it said they were updating the formula soon. I can't believe it took me this long to put 2 and 2 together, but I've ordered him another type of food and am giving him a bland diet til it gets here. He just came inside from going potty and very clearly had diarrhea. I feel awful that he's gone through these last couple of weeks with such horrible stomach problems and me being clueless and just finding alternate ways to feed this food to him. (like half his usual amount in the morning, half in the afternoon, etc.) I thought he was also just losing a little weight because he was getting older, but it's clearly because of this stuff. For shame, changing the formula and putting dogs at risk, especially mine that's a senior and needs all the balance and health in his life that he can get.

body: DO NOT BUY THIS FOOD Normally, I don’t usually care enough about a product to write a review (negative or positive) but I did feel the need to share our experience with this dog food. We have been feeding both of our dogs this food for years with no issues. Recently, Natural Balance changed their formula to add more protein. Now, this didn’t really raise a red flag for us because we figured this wouldn’t affect our dogs. When we bought our most recent bag of this food (May 2020) and opened it to fill our dogs’ food container, we noticed a very pungent smell coming from the food. It wasn’t necessarily a BAD smell, just a lot stronger than normal. Within a few feedings, one of our dogs (small breed) went from missing the occasional meal to outright refusing to eat it at all and only eating to prevent herself from starving. She would eat treats and table scraps, which told us that her appetite wasn’t the problem. Same dog started vomiting more often: typically after having missed a feeding or two or she would eat large amounts of grass to soothe her poor tummy and induce vomiting. At this point, we didn’t conclude it had anything to do with the food because our other dog (large breed) was eating and behaving normally. We consulted our vet at their yearly appointment and she didn’t seem to think much of this new behavior but advised us to give her bland food as needed. When we started to run low on this food, we made the decision to switch to a completely different brand. Since switching, our dog has stopped vomiting, missing meals, and seems a lot more energized and happier and it’s only been a few days.In conclusion, if you’re thinking of switching your dog food to this brand or continuing to feed them this particular food, beware! We looked up the formula change to see if anyone else had the same experience and many other dog parents were reporting similar behaviors. As of now, there aren’t any recalls out there that we know of but I wouldn’t be surprised if they issue one soon.
subject: Natural Balance L.I.D. Limited Ingredient Diets Dry Dog Food, Duck & Brown Rice Formula, 26 Pounds

body: Beware: New Formula, My Dog Hates it! The new formula of Lamb and Rice LID is terrible. My dog with food allergies has eaten this brand and this flavor for over 7 years without issue, until the new and improved formula hit the shelves in the last month or so. She refuses to eat it or when she’s finally hungry enough to give in and eat it, she has had tummy problems. After a few weeks, I took  her to the vet because of weight loss and digestive (poop) issues thinking she was sick. The good news, nothing is wrong with my dog; the vet asked about her food and she knew right away the problem was not my dog but the new formula as the vet has had several other owners with the same problems. Whatever Natural Balance did to the formula did not improve anything, except perhaps their pocketbooks! Very disappointed with the purchase and so sad for my dog who now has to adjust to a new food. Food consistency is so vital for a dog’s health, consult any veterinarian (I assume Natural Balance didn’t). So now I have to experiment with new brands and foods to find the right fit for my beloved dog. And when I say new food, I mean a different brand entirely, I won’t be buying Natural Balance food anymore and will move on to a competitor’s line.

body: Switched from Blue Buffalo I finally switched my 30lb german shepherd mix over to this food last month. Since she was a puppy I have been giving her the blue buffalo wilderness (chicken and lifesource bits). But she has always taken mouthfulls of the food, spit it out, and eaten only the brown pieces and left the little black ones. I was also wary after reading about grain free foods and the health issues it can cause. So because of all of that, I decided to switch her over. She seems to like it a lot more, and I've noticed she has been eating more since I switched her. She free feeds, and never eats everything I put in front of her. She is a lean dog - not overly skinny, but definitely could use a few extra pounds. The switch was seamless and she didn't have any digestive issues. I know you're supposed to mix the new with the old when you are transitioning, but I didn't do that and she was fine. I will be sticking to this food from now on. It's convenient to have it on auto-delivery.
